title: The Grey Suspended Water
tagline: An exiled writer navigates the cold currents of London, his father's political past, and the haunting silence where his stories used to be.
themes: Fathers and Sons in the Diaspora
The Silence of the Writer Abroad

story: Write a letter from Kofi to his mother in Lagos, describing a mundane London experience through the lens of profound dislocation.
Compose Miriam's internal monologue as she observes the strained relationship between the Professor and Kofi over dinner.
Draft the 'too direct' article Kofi wrote that forced his exile from Lagos.
Write a scene where Kofi discovers a marginal note in one of his father's books that changes his understanding of the past.
technical: Build a 'Silence Index' web app that analyzes text for sensory density (sounds, smells, textures), contrasting Kofi's Lagos writing with his London drafts.
Create an interactive map tracing the novel's dual geographies: the physical London locations and the remembered/imagined spaces of Lagos and political history.
